thread.title: Bill Clinton to headline his first rally for wife's 2016 bid
thread.title_full: Bill Clinton to headline his first rally for wife's 2016 bid

title: Bill Clinton to headline his first rally for wife's 2016 bid
text:
Updated: 1:57 p.m. Monday, Oct. 19, 2015 | Posted: 1:57 p.m. Monday, Oct. 19, 2015 Bill Clinton to headline his first rally for wife's 2016 bid Related View Larger FILE - In this June 13, 2015 file photo, Democratic presidential candidate, former Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton, and her husband, former President Bill Clinton, gesture to supporters on Roosevelt Island in New York. Former President Bill Clinton will headline his first rally for his wife’s presidential campaign on Saturday. He plans to address supporters of Hillary Rodham Clinton’s second White House bid before the Iowa Democratic Party dinner in Des Moines. The gathering is an important stop for presidential candidates seeking support in the early caucus state. (AP Photo/Frank Franklin II, File) By LISA LERER The Associated Press WASHINGTON — 
Former President Bill Clinton will headline his first rally for his wife's presidential campaign on Saturday. 
He plans to address supporters of Hillary Rodham Clinton 's second White House bid before the Iowa Democratic Party dinner in Des Moines. The gathering is an important stop for presidential candidates seeking support in the early caucus state. 
The former president will be joined by pop star Katy Perry , who endorsed Clinton earlier this year. 
After largely staying off his wife's campaign, Clinton has taken a more active role recently. He's begun raising money for her bid at events across the country. With the highest favorability of any living president, Bill Clinton is considered one of his party's most effective messengers. Copyright The Associated Press
